Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 09:52AM Winner1213 wrote: RESULTS! Fibroadenoma !   All three of them!  It is unusual for a woman my age (53) to develop them for the first time, but, I'm so glad I did.  Instead of something else, you know!   YIPPEEE..   Thank you all so much for your care and support. You are each lovely, lovely, women!  I wish nothing but the very, very, best for each of you.  Really.   With gratitude, Winner1213   (Barb)
Posts.Title: Hope I won't be back here often, but could use some feedback. Winner1213 Winner1213

Posts.Content: Winner1213 wrote: First of all,  you are, each and every one of you AWESOME, wonderful people supporting each other and helping others.  Thank you for that. Here's what's up. Mammogram came back on 10/4 with an area of concern. Scheduled ultrasound.  Went there on the 10th.  Tech took TONS and TONS of pics.  Radiologist reviewed them and requested MORE pictures.  We did that, and he reviewed those, THEN asked for another Mammogram.  Did that.  Review.  Consult.  One mass at about 8:00 left breast.  2 cm.  irregular shape, second mass at 3:00, similar characteristics only 1 cm.  I received the radiology report today, it stated, "suspected malignancy"  Biopsies on both are scheduled for Monday.   I hate waiting more than anything.  :-(  Thank you for listening, and any kind or encouraging words would help too.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hope I won't be back here often, but could use some feedback. Winner1213 Winner1213

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2012 04:49PM Winner1213 wrote: I called the imaging clinic this afternoon,  as the Dr. said we should have results today.  Spoke to the nicest young fella.  He read (silently) for a minute and then said, no, I don't have a final report yet, but here is my direct number, I'm here till 6,  call as often as you want.  I'll be on the look out for you.   So,  I think,  since there is not a "final" report,  there must be a preliminary one.  I imagine, he wouldn't be allowed to discuss that with me.  But OMG.  I really just want to know. (Obvs) I can't wait to feel  soooooo DUMB for being so internally hysterical.    thanks for listening.

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2012 01:51PM Winner1213 wrote: Hi momma4boys! The waiting is PURE torture, and should be entirely illegal.  My experience with Biopsy results was 4 business days.  The Dr. told us there was a 4%  (FOUR %!) chance these tumors would be benign.  There were three of them, four days later,  ALL three benign.  I am so sorry you are experiencing the pain of the wait.  I hope you will take some solace in my experience/results. ((((HUGS)))) Barb
